page.title: 11POPULATION, NORTH CREAKE
page.content: The population of N Creake is about 355. The numbers have risen in recent years, as elderly people have retired to the area, and cottages once lived in by agricultural workers have been converted into holiday homes. At the first census in 1801, the returns showed that there were 405 inhabitants; the figures rose to their peak of 659 in 1871; falling to 518 in 1901. The village primary school closed in the mid 1970's, for lack of numbers. The majority of the state pensioners draw their money from the local sub post office; with a few having it paid into their bank accounts. None of the usual professions are to be found in the village, except for the Priest-in-Charge, whose residence is the vicarage of the village of South Creake.
